data.title: Countries that use the Algerian dinar
data.meta_description: Usage and exchange rates of the Algerian dinar. Convert DZD to any other currency.
data.text:
The Algerian dinar was established in 1964 as an official national currency and is used only in Algeria. It replaced the previously valid Algerian new franc. 1 Dinar is devided into 100 Centimes.

ISO 4127:

DZD

Numeric:

012

Symbol:

د.ج

List of all currencies

Overview: Algeria

1.00 Algerian dinars = 0.0074 US dollars

Currency:

Convert to:

Amount:

↔ Reverse currencies

Exchange rate history 1000 DZD in USD

The graph shown here shows the exchange rate development from January 2018 to March 2024. The exchange rate for 1000 DZD moved during this time from USD 8.79 to USD 7.43. In these 74 months it fell by 15.5 percent.

› Inflation development in Algeria

Currency reserves for the Algerian dinar

According to the International Monetary Fund, the total broad money (M3) amounted to DZD 24.331 trillion at the end of 2023. For currency hedging, reserves were held in a total amount of 11.033 trillion dinars. This corresponds to a ratio of 1:2.2. Or in other words, 10 of 22 dinars are deposited with a countervalue, which is internationally already above average.

Approximately 329.17 billion dinars (3.0%) of the currency reserves exist in gold reserves. The remainder consists of foreign currencies, special drawing rights in the International Monetary Fund and other reserve positions.

› Worldwide currency and gold reserves

Sources

All conversion rates are based on data from the European Central Bank.

Data on currency and gold reserves are from the International Monetary Fund.
